thread.title: Orica lowers profit guidance by 10-15 pct
thread.title_full: Orica lowers profit guidance by 10-15 pct

title: Orica lowers profit guidance by 10-15 pct
text:
Print 
Orica has revised down its profit guidance by between 10 and 15 per cent due to challenging conditions facing the mining sector. 
Orica had anticipated full year profit of about $490 million, almost 20 per cent down on last year, when it reports in November but factors including lower-than-expected sodium cyanide production, increased environment provisions and reduced asset sales have further knocked that figure. 
The company on Friday also announced a reduction in the value of its assets of between $1.35 billion and $1.65 billion and is now reviewing the share buyback it announced in March. 
Chief executive Alberto Calderon said the Orica was now in a stronger long-term position but that "action is needed on the elements of our business that are not working as well as we would like". @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook McDonald's cuts 225 jobs to revive biz AAP 
McDonald's says it is cutting about 225 corporate jobs as part of a push intended to revitalise its flagging business. â€¦
